title: Andy's Ancestry
description: Nellie plays a trick on Andy after researching his ancestry, Dwight teaches Erin a new language, and Pam tries to teach Nellie how to drive.

quotes.speaker: Fake Jim
quotes.text: Morning, Dwight

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Who are you?

quotes.speaker: Fake Jim
quotes.text: Who am I? I'm Jim. We've been working together for twelve years. Ha, Weird joke, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're not Jim. Jim's not Asian

quotes.speaker: Fake Jim
quotes.text: You seriously never noticed? Hey, hats off to you for not seeing race.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Alright then Jim. Ahhh, why don't you tell me about that sale that you made yesterday?

quotes.speaker: Fake Jim
quotes.text: Uh, Wellington systems? Sold them 10 cases of 24-pound letter stock. Or, were you talking about Krieger-Murphy? Because I didn't close that one yet, but I'm hoping I've got a voicemail from Paul Krieger waiting for me.

quotes.speaker: Voicemail
quotes.text: Please enter your password.

quotes.speaker: Voicemail
quotes.text: You have one new message.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: How did you know? No! No, no! That is sensitive information only for employees, not outsiders!

quotes.speaker: Fake Jim
quotes.text: Dwight, cut it out, I'm trying to work.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You don't work here! You're not Jim!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim, I got us that dinner reservation. Grico's at 7:30.

quotes.speaker: Fake Jim
quotes.text: Oh great, can't wait. [Kisses Pam]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim's at the dentist this morning. And Steve is an actor friend of ours.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I don't know who you are, but you are not Jim. This is Jim!

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Dwight shows fake Jim of the Halpert family portrait but notices that Jim and the kids have been replaced with fake Jim and Asian kids]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh my--! Oh d--! Oh, how did--? [gasps] Huhhhhh!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Heyyy! Study buddies!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, ok.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Getting things done. Awesome!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's all about finding ways to make yourself more efficient. Life hacking, baby. This morning, I brushed my teeth in the shower. Saved my self 90 seconds. Which I just used to explain this to you. Damn it!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Since Andy promoted me to assistant regional manager, I've been trying to step my game up, you know, be more productive. In fact, you know what? Let's knock out a few more of these sound bites while we're here. [pauses] Whoa! That person has really gotten him or herself into quite a predicament.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [speaking in French] S"il vous plait...dites-Moi...Ugggghhh les Bleagh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ah, French. It's a great language. If you're a chain-smoking acrobat.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm just trying to fit in better with Andy's family. They all speak more than one language. Usually when I'm there!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You wanna learn a really impressive second language? Try dothraki. Win over any man in my guild.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dothraki is the native tongue of the nomadic war-mongering horse lords of Essos as featured in the superb Home Box Office series, Game of Thrones. It has a lot of nudity. Which I fast-forward through to get to the chopped-off heads.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I could teach you if you want. It's a lot easier than French.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah!  Let's do it!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [exclaims] Atherozar!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [shocked] Oh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It means "excellent". And we have begun.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [asks Nellie who is tapping a pen on her desk]. Is everything okay?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Hmm? Oh--oh, yeah. Yeah, yeah, yeah, fine. Fine, fine, fine.  I'm mean, I d--I just don't wanna--burden you with my massive stress freak outs!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: It's just that I am taking my driver's license test in two days, and I need to practice with an experienced driver in the car. But I've had no time to do that, thanks to "Demandy"...[Points to Andy's office with her thumb].  I just want to hit the open road and drive, man! But...in who's car?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [yells] Nellie! Get your wrinkly old balls in here.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [sighs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nellie, I could practice with you in my car at lunchtime.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, Pam, thank you! You are my savior!  [hugs Pam]

quotes.speaker: {nellie} and {pam}
quotes.text: [giggling] ohhhhhhhhhhhhhh!!!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Jim] I'm sorry, I'm leaving you alone for lunch.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Don't worry about it. I have a thing. A thing of soup. Which I've been wanting to try.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: This is my research into how we might produce child-proof paper that doesn't give you paper cuts. We can't. And here is a print out of your genealogy from thisisyourfamilytree.com

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Executive-summary me. Hit the highlights.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well, it turns out, you are a distant blood relative of Michelle Obama!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: As in...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Wife of Barack, loves gardening, wants to wipe out fat children.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [silently mouths] Wow!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is super-flattering. She's the most popular person in America. This is a big day for both of us.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: My fellow Americans, I have a feeling my approval rating is about to go through the roof. Turns out, I am related to Michelle Obama.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I was intimidated by Andy's family before. And now I have to see the First Lady at holidays? She's gonna be like, "What's your stance on politics?" Or, "What is the best war to do?" And, I will just be like, "Duhhhh!"

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Alright! We gotta get rid of all this junk food. Get fit, America! Not sure if the buzz has reached the annex yet, but uh...I'm related to Michelle Obama.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Clark and Peter clap]

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Yeah we noticed early on, Andy really appreciates enthusiasm.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: So we decided the best way to get ahead here is to be his cheerleaders.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Oooohhhhhhhh!

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [They clap when Andy slams dunks his garbage into the bin]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [They clap when Andy prints a paper copy out]

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [They clap when the water cooler jar makes bubbles while Andy is standing next to it.]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: It's starting to have this reverse effect, though, where I really do think the stuff he does is awesome.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Yeah, me too. It's weird. Hard to remember what's real at this point.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Just clap through it, man.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You log in sales at ten different times. If you log 'em all at once, you save a lot of time. It's called batching.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That was really good, Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Life hacking, man.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: There he is!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Andy, you gotta check this out. He just showed me--[gets interrupted by Andy].

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [shushing Jim] Ahhhthathathathathta. Right now I need canned tuna, okay? Darryl, guess which talented individual, who also has a killer singing voice, is related to the First Lady?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Tracee Ellis Ross. Daughter of the First Lady of Motown, Diana Ross.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's me! [chuckles] I am related to Michelle Obama.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What?! Really?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I mean, it's distant, but...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [chuckles in agreement] Huh ha! That's cool, man.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Darryl said, "Cool, man." He called me as cool man.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know, I really do think it would be worth it to pull over and just take ten minutes to eat.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Mmmm--the thing is Pam, I'm gonna be eating while I'm driving, so, I might as well get good at it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Brake lights. Break lights! Break lights! Break lights!!!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Whhooooo!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm just saying, what does it imply in this country when a white person shares an ancestor with a black person?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You think that Andy's family owned slaves?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Well somebody owned somebody. And I don't think anybody would buy an Andy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I throat-rip.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Foth aggendak!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You throat-rip.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Foth aggendi!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He/she/it throat rips.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Foth aggenda!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: More of a, barbaric growl.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [in a barbaric growl] Forth aggenda!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Louder! You're shouting it from the back of a horse!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Wah!! Aggenda!!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Pretty crazy about Andy and Michelle Obama, huh?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [laughs mischievously] Yeeeeahhhh! It's almost unbelievable!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well, you know how Andy has been really salting my onions, lately.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well, when he asked me to look up his ancestry online, I remembered that news story about Michelle Obama having white relatives, and I just knew he would eat that up!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So he's not related to Michelle Obama?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Pam, I barely know how to turn on my computer.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Nellie's pretty fearless. And I think she might be maybe even almost sort of fun.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [whispers] Pam! [she pretends to slam a wrench over the tire service guy's head].

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well, if there's another explanation, I don't really see what it could possibly be. I--[gets cut by Andy barging into the convo]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What's going on here? I'm related to the first lady, okay? Get over it. [chuckles] I still need weekly status reports from most of you, sooooo, can we get back to work, please? Get back to work! [Mimicks smacking everyone with a whipl].

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Andy! Andy! No! I would be very polite today.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Why? Is it employee's day or something? I cannot keep track of these BS holidays.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Your connection. To Michelle Obama has certain... negative connotations. Most likely, your family were--slave owners.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Does anyone else think it's possible that I come from slave owners?

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [everyone raises their hands.]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Whoa! That person has really gotten him or herself into quite a predicament.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey mom, it's Andy. Give me a call when you get a chance gotta quick question for you, uhhhh no big deal just about America's national shame, thanks, Bye.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Continues] Where were we? Uhhhh, yes. Okay. Your...productivity thing.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yes, yes, yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Great. Ooo! Spreadsheets! Yum, yum!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I included some time saving ideas...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Huh huh huh. Look, I'm not gonna lie to ya, I'm a teensy bit distracted right now.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Look, Andy, even if your ancestors did own slaves, it wouldn't be your fault. This is only weird if you make it weird.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [snaps his fingers] Right on, brotha. Wurddd.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Addor!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Daraas!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Qazer!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Daraas!  [asks the rest of the office] Does anyone here have fermented mare's milk?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Hey Erin!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Azem choma! Chomakka-attun!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Oh--okay. Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, still, it must great to have something else going on outside of work.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah--turn signal. It's exciting to be painting again--those are the wipers. So--the--its--just. There you go! Yeah. [chuckles]  Yeah, things get so busy with the kids--red light--that it's nice to have that creative outlet--red light! Red light! Red! Red!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: That is brilliant, Pam. I would love to see some of your work.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, since we're stopped at a light, uhhh, here is...the mural I did for Angela's baby.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: That's amazing, Pam! Oh, I love the lion in the tuxedo!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Angela insisted that all the animals be fully clothed.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [to Erin]. Heyyy, has anyone turned in their status reports up here?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Vos!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So, no? You think maybe you could remind people? I'm trying to down play the whole bossy boss thing today.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Because of your slaves.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Not my slaves, my ancestors'. Maybe. Probably not.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well, if it makes you feel any better, the dothraki word for "slave master", "attafrauk!", is a term of respect. I'm learning how to speak dothraki! Color you impressed?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That you're learning a made-up language from HBO's Game of Thrones?  I have a lot going on today...but this was a great nerd-out!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Dwight, you didn't tell me you were teaching me a fake language.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: People laughed at Klingon at first, and now you can major in it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hi guys.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hey boss! I am so thirsty. Could I have a scoop of water?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah. You don't have to ask me.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Phyllis lets out stifled laughter]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ha ha! Okay. Great. Very funny. I get it. Just because my ancestors happen to be--[ringtone of Dixie plays].  Very funny, Kevin. Changed my ringtone. Very funny. I liked the original song on my ringtone, which, you may remember, was "Diamonds on the Soles of Her Shoes" by Paul Simon, featurinnnngg Lady Smith--African American--Mambazo.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good. Very good. [cell phone beeping]Oh--no! Here. It's, uh, a text from Andy. "New special proj. Need fam tree for evbody. Really dig up dirt A.S.A.P." And then in parentheses, he wrote out "as soon as possible."

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Mm. Ugh, looks like its pretend-y time again. Write back, "looking for dirt."

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, can I help? We could say someone is related to, uhm, Tonya Harding.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Pam, I'm related to Tonya Harding.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh--gee--I'm--

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: No! I'm just practicing my lyyiiinggg! [whispers] I love it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Brilliant!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: What should we say about Jim?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ummm. Oh! I'll say he's related to Richard Nixon. It's an inside joke. He looks really Nixon-y when he wakes up.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: My ex behaved like Nixon. All of the lying. None of the sexual charisma. [pauses] I just made a joke there.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I'm sorry. It's just, uhm, I actually do have this weird feeling that there's something Jim isn't telling me.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh no! Oh! An affair! It is always an affair!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim? No.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [sighs]. How can you be sure?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Because he just loves me too much.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: You're a cocky little thing, aren't you, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I've done a little genealogy research of my own. Turn out I'm not the only one with a few skeletons in the ol' family closet. For example, Phyllis's great-great grandmother was responsible for spreading cholera to the United States.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Ew.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Kevin is related to both John Wayne Gacy and John Wayne Bobbitt.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: And John Wayne?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No. Not that I see here.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Wayne Johnson? The Rock?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You mean Dwayne? And no. What about Jim Halpert? Uh oh! Turns out, distant relative of the reviled, Richard Nixon!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pam always says I look like Nixon. That's crazy, right? I mean there's nothing there. True--[touches his nose] Oh no.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Dwight's grandfather was a--[is interrupted by Dwight].

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Was a member of the Bund. Which is not technically the same thing as the Nazi party. So...[clears throat]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I was gonna say he was a tax evader.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh. I was joking about that whole Bund thing. Oh ho, the look on your faces! Hahhahahahahah! Hahahahahah!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And Meredith is a blood relative of Lizzie Borden.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Cool! Ah! Ah! Ah! Ah! [mimics stabbing into Angela's throat]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Stop it! Stop it! You're frightening me!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Andy, did you call this meeting just to talk junk about our families?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, that--you're being really mean, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, I'm proving a point, okay? We all have ancestors who may have done horrible things in the past. But it's in the past and it's not our fault. So we don't have to talk about it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: The difference is, Andy, that you're the only be here still benefitting from the terrible things that your ancestors did.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Might've done. And how... do you figure?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Your family's rich! I have to believe that a big part of the Bernard fortune was earned on the backs of slaves.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You know, there's nothing wrong with being successful in America, Oscar! I'm not gonna apologize for my family's wealth. That wealth, could one day benefit society...if capital gains are ever taxed as the same rate as earned income.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [ringtone of Dixie plays]  Okay, Kevin did that. I do not wish I was in Dixie.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [answers phone]  Hey mom, how are ya? Did any Bernards ever own a plantation in the south?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [to the group]  She said no! Take that!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [gets back on phone]  Follow up question. Did any Bernards, ever, make money, in an unsavory way?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [speaks quietly into the phone] I just asked you! Why didn't you just say that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [continues speaking quietly] Oh, stop! Stop! Stop talking! Stop taking! That's--no! I don't wanna know that. Ok. You're interrupting a meeting I have to go. Love you. Bye.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [faces the group] Well, turns out the Bernard's of yore did not own slaves.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: We merely transported them. Which at worst, makes us amoral middlemen.

quotes.speaker: None
quotes.text: [Clark begins to clap but Pete immediately stops him.]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yo, d-dog. I need your help. I'm trying to think of things I can say that make it sound like I had a more difficult childhood than I actually had.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: You're gonna po' mouth

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Exactly. Help me po' mouth, Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Actually, Andy, you promised me five minutes to talk about productivity suggestions--

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What if I said that my dad beat me. And, I just left out the croquet of it all. Or, I could just go all the way and just say I grew up in an apartment. Or is that too crazy?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That could work.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You now, Darryl, this is textbook assistant regional manager stuff here, and I feel like I'm doing all the heavy lifting. I'm coming up with all the ideas here.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'm going for a walk.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [with a sigh] Okay.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good. Good. And--[Nellie hits the car against the bushes]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You doing alright, man?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I'm done. I gotta get out of here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah. Not the easiest day to be assistant regional manager.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's not just today, it's everyday. It seems like the better title I have, the stupider my job gets.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, come on, it can always get better. Right?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hmm. Yeah right

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No, I'm serious. There's always something better.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Like what?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Like hypothetically... if I said there was another job. That you and I could both have.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What kind of job?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Something cool. Like, sports marketing or... that sound something like you'd be into?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hell yeah!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That sounds awesome!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, but wait. What if I told you that it was in Philly! So you'd have to...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I love Philly!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Right?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's not even a thought--

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not even a thought!  It's not even that far away! I could still commute! Exactly. Exactly! Alright!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: What? Wait, wait, wait? So what? This happening?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, it's happening!  Let's just keep it between you and me for right now.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah. Yeah, yeah, yeah. For sure. For sure. for sure. Man!  And Pam's into it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We, uh, we haven't talked about. But I think that she's--I think she understands... what this is.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Oh, come on, man. I thought you had something real.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What? No, no, no! Come on! This is real!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's not real... until your wife is on board.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So what did you want to show me?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: That is quite an ugly wall, isn't it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. It's really ugly

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Needs something, doesn't it? I'm thinking...a mural.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You mean me?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Yes! You! You are soo talented! It's going to be my next special project. Hiring Scranton's most dangerous young muralist to paint the warehouse wall.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my god! I love it! Uh, I--Nellie, this is brilliant!  [sees Jim] Hey!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey! Can I talk you? For a second?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Anything you have to say to her, you can say to me. She never loved you!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What?! No! I-I got this. [Laughs] Okay?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [quietly] This is his fault. It is not your fault. I'm gonna find you someone better, and rich.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: And Filipino. But we'll break that to her later.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [to Darryl] You know what this is all about.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yeah. You too, huh?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Yeah. Go on, spill it. Tell her all the gory details, youuuu sssnake!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hey! He deserves this. And he said I could get in on it too.  [whispers] Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Ohhh, Pam, nooo! Oh, I can't bear to watch this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I don't know what I was so worried about. I have the best wife in the world.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I still can't believe he didn't tell me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I was helping Nellie drive--[Stanley interrupts]

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Do not care.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Fonas chek!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Dothraas! chek! [giggles]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I like that guy. We should hook him up with Meredith.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [in agreement] Hmmm!
